intro: Xamilenis dinarica, commonly known as the Dinaric bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late summer to early autumn. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
